title: Eugene Ionesco - Rhinoceros & Other Plays (9 books)
description:
EUGÃƒË†NE IONESCO  (1909-1994) was a Romanian playwright who wrote mostly in French, and one of the foremost figures of the French avant-garde theatre.  Beyond ridiculing the most banal situations, Ionesco's plays depict the solitude and insignificance of human existence in a tangible way.


The following books are in PDF format:

* A STROLL IN THE AIR / FRENZY FOR TWO, OR MORE (Grove, 1965).  Translated by Donald Watson.

* EXIT THE KING (Grove, 1963).  Translated by Donald Watson.

* FOUR PLAYS: The Bald Soprano / The Lesson / Jack, or the Submission / The Chairs (Grove, 1958).  Translated by Donald M. Allen.

* FRAGMENTS OF A JOURNAL (Grove, 1968).  Translated by Jean Stewart.

* HUNGER AND THIRST & OTHER PLAYS (Grove, 1969).  Translated by Donald Watson.  Includes "The Picture", "Anger", and "Salutations".

* THE KILLER & OTHER PLAYS (Grove, 1960).  Translated by Donald Watson.

* MACBETT (Grove, 1973).  Translated by Charles Marowitz.

* RHINOCEROS & OTHER PLAYS (Grove, 1960).  Translated by Derek Prouse.  Includes "The Leader" and "The Future is in Eggs, or It Takes All Sorts to Make a World".

* THREE PLAYS: AmÃƒÂ©dÃƒÂ©e / The New Tenant / Victims of Duty (Grove, 1958).  Translated by Donald Watson
